title: Goulding reveals the GF ‘live’ truth
text:
ACCLAIMED British chart-topper Ellie Goulding has laughed off her brush with the AFL entertainment curse, preferring technical glitches to being a “perfect pop star”. 
Goulding copped criticism and accusations of miming during her pre-game performance on Saturday. 
The 28-year-old singer, who is widely praised for nailing high notes out of the reach of mere mortals, jokes that she is an abject failure as a mime artist. 
As explained by her Australian promoter Michael Gudinski, a sound technician pressed play on the backing tracks for both of her hits Love Me Like You Do and Burn instead of one at a time. 
“I would rather something go wrong than go up there and people think I am this perfect pop star who everything goes right for, and I’m not human, I’m a robot,” she said. 
Goulding, who rocked out with her band during a concert at the Enmore Theatre on Sunday night, said she had no choice but to sing live to the backing track. Big lungs ... There was no mistaking the live vocals at the Enmore Theatre concert on Sunday. Picture: Kristi Miller. Source: News Corp Australia 
The tight production schedules of the match entertainment meant that not all artists can have their band perform fully live in the middle of the massive sports ground. 
Goulding and her backing vocalists sing live and her band mimes their “playing”. 
“I think technically the thing that people don’t understand is when I am given a gig like that, I don’t have the option of playing with my band live,” she said. 
“We’re given this amazing opportunity to play and they say ‘We ain’t got time for you to play live, we’ve got other singers to deal with, we’ve got Bryan Adams and whoever else’. 
“People don’t realise that most of their favourite artists, their favourite performers, have to do that all the time.” 
Goulding not only managed to get her gig back on track but defended herself admirably on social media afterwards as fans also rallied to support her. Love it when people think I lip sync, what a rad compliment :) Now where does one find a good veggie restaurant in Melbs? — Ellie Goulding (@elliegoulding) October 3, 2015 
“I’m not hurt by any accusations of lip-synching. I don’t bloody lip-synch. If I lip-synched I would be terrible at it,” she said. 
“Saturday was fun, we were all having such a laugh and whatever, it doesn’t bother me, I know people here know I perform well live. I’ve got other things to worry about right now.”One of those things concerning the On My Mind artist is her health. 
As well as battling the flu before her AFL gig and Sunday night’s concert, the renowned fitness fanatic revealed she has had to stop exercising in the last week. Good times ... Goulding says Team Ellie had fun at the AFL Grand Final despite the technical glitches which railroaded her performance. Picture: Wayne Ludbey Source: News Corp Australia 
While sleeping-in has been a bonus, she will have to address a “heart thing” when she returns home to the UK ahead of the launch of her new record Delirium , which will be released on November 6. 
“I found out I have this heart thing and I need to get it checked out. I’m fine, it’s actually something someone discovered last year but I never got it checked out. Which is terrible, I have been playing with my life,” she said. 
“So I have been very relaxed, I have been chilling and not being as militant about what I eat. 
“It’s nice to know you actually can’t go to the gym, you’re not allowed.” 
Goulding is finalising negotiations for her return to tour in support of Delirium next year.
